definition: to live together (in a large group or flock)
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: The web may be a combined effort of social cobweb spiders.
sentences.chinese: 巨型蜘蛛网可能是由群居的蜘蛛共同织造成。

sentences.english: Ishi Tib live in communal groups, in harmony with the nature of their planet.
sentences.chinese: 伊希提卜人分部落群居，与星球的自然环境和谐相处。

sentences.english: For example, an elephant is a herd animal, so it responds to 17)hierarchy.
sentences.chinese: 例如，大象是群居动物，所以它有等级观念。

sentences.english: Chinese White Dolphins live together and move in groups.
sentences.chinese: 中华白海豚是群居动物，经常联群结队活动。
人类天生就是群居动物。

sentences.english: They also differ from the inland forests in that certain species are practically gregarious over extensive areas.
sentences.chinese: 它们与陆地树林的不同之处还在于它们大面积群居。

sentences.english: This evidence suggested Smilodon lived in groups.
sentences.chinese: 这个证据正好表明剑齿虎是群居动物。

sentences.english: Humans and wolves both lived in groups.
sentences.chinese: 人类和狼都是群居动物。

sentences.english: For millions of years hominids lived in small bands, cooperating to find food and sharing what they found.
sentences.chinese: 百万年来，人类行小规模群居，互助觅食并共享所得。

sentences.english: Man's ancestors lived in groups in caves in primitive times.
sentences.chinese: 原始时代的人类的祖先们都是群居穴处的。

sentences.english: The finding that Edmontosaurs lived in herds further supports the migration hypothesis.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙顿龙属群居动物这一发现，支持了迁徙说。

sentences.english: It was not until we arrived there that we found it was isolated. 6.Wolves are highly social animals whose success depends upon their cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 狼是高度群居动物，它们依靠合作成功捕食。

sentences.english: Social insects are well-known for their willingness to die for their colonies;
sentences.chinese: 群居的昆虫是以自愿为他们的领地去死而著称的。

definition: to live in a cave/(of animals) to be of burrowing habit
population (of a species)/community (of animals or plants)
to prey on/to catch and feed on/to hunt for food
to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
(of a bird) to perch/(of creatures in general) to inhabit/to dwell
